title: Grandma & Grandad Haywood's Splitscreen 1963 Devon Caravette

posts.content: That is a lovely bus! Nice picture!
Yes Caravette, I am on the left at the bottom of the steps, I am told that this was 1966 in Ireland.

This was in 1969 in Northern Spain with the awning in place




And with a change of livery in 1970 back in Ireland with upturned boat on top.

type21f wrote:


.


those are the curtains you would normally expect to see in a red devon from 62 onâ€¦.i've never seen the (similar) pattern in ma & pops Haywoods bus

BernardSamba wrote:This was in 1969 in Northern Spain with the awning in place




And with a change of livery in 1970 back in Ireland with upturned boat on top.




So cool

The curtain pattern in Dave's Grandparents' Caravette was a big surprise to me.....with light grey duracour.
The picture of the curtains I have posted in the 62 Caravette are in a Mouse Grey/ Seagull grey Caravette with Red duracour. So maybe that was a popular choice with this colourway.
I have no idea when Devon introduced their Interior guide...
There is one on the Katy Devon Moonraker site and I have "acquired" a 1967 version.
I have never seen any more...They must have been issued to dealers....
But from when?
I reckon mine must have been the last Splitscreen ones...

I am pretty sure those are the same curtains we had in ours but we have grey Duracour cushions, it was a while ago because my mother replaced them with yellow in 1970/71 when the van went to its Ford colours of Fern green/Bronze. I have only just noticed that in the boat photo we had the four legged table outside on its short legs, I must try and track those down.

I have been looking for some of the red 1962 curtain shown in the sink picture.
Always love asking in Haberdashers for 60 geometric curtain material without any leads...
L O L
For my 62 Devonette the material is called Toile de Juoy in a Magenta shade with hummingbirds on it.
The pattern I am looking at is called Pemberley. ..
SAD or what..... ..

author.location: Bridgnorth, Shropshire. I am a member :o)

posts.content:
BernardSamba wrote:I have only just noticed that in the boat photo we had the four legged table outside on its short legs, I must try and track those down.


Hmmm are you saying that all Devons came with both tall legs AND short legs?

I have a set of tall.... not ever seen a Devon with short..... intrigued now....

As we bought our Devon when it was six months old I can only say that there were tall legs for the three and the four leg tables and we had some short legs so that us kids could sit on the ground. I do not know if they were standard items or an optional extra from Devon.

How long are your short legs?

I think I asked Graham once before but I've searched back to 2010 and can't find a public record - maybe it was in a PM.

I believe that you could order as many legs as you liked!

As my maths was not very good...three tables with four legs = twelve if you want all the tables outside
I got nine 25.5" legs with my 65 Caravette! Why nine I have no idea...

With the 64 Caravette we got eight legs? Four at 25.5" and four at 25" hard to tell that they are different and easy to mix up!!

I bought a set of four Devon Bay legs and these were the shorter 57cm long legs 22.4" long from the forum. The paint on these was missing, split and peeling. I scraped all the paint off and had them painted by Dusty Dave and they look great!

Bay Devons also came with 12" legs for when bed was pulled out!

Rippers has/had two sets of 12" legs for sale if you want short ones to use for the children

Sadly, I no longer have them, all the legs got half inched along with loads of other stuff that is hard to find again (valuable).

Luckily my father-in-law took up the challenge and bought a wood lathe and made me some new legs. Once he had finished these he sold the lathe and I forgot to ask him for the short ones.

I have seen Rippers's legs; I have access to a lathe; I had an idea... hence my curiousness about correct length.

A Spaceway has a shorty or three doesn't it? Perhaps someone with one of those will show me their length?
